answer.text: UnifyWeaver requires SWI-Prolog, a comprehensive Prolog environment. SWI-Prolog provides the runtime for executing UnifyWeaver's declarative specifications and compiling them to target languages.

code_blocks.code:
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install swi-prolog

# Arch Linux
sudo pacman -S swi-prolog

# Fedora
sudo dnf install pl

# macOS (Homebrew)
brew install swi-prolog

# Windows (winget)
winget install SWI-Prolog.SWI-Prolog

# Termux (Android)
pkg install swi-prolog

answer.text: After installing SWI-Prolog, verify the installation by checking the version and running a simple query.

code_blocks.code:
# Check version
swipl --version

# Run a simple test
swipl -g "writeln('Hello from Prolog'), halt"

% Interactive test - type at ?- prompt
?- X = hello.
X = hello.

?- halt.
